bibl.title: A Papyrus of Old Comedy (P. Oxy. 863 + 2806).
bibl.note: P. Oxy. VI, 863 = Eupolis fr. *101 K.-A. (= M.-P.3 1632; LDAB 892) and P. Oxy. XXXVII, 2806 (= M.-P.3 252.1; LDAB 5105) belong to the same hand. It may be safest to consider the papyrus an adespoton, perhaps the work of Cratinus.
bibl.seg: W.B. Henry, A Papyrus of Old Comedy (P. Oxy. 863 + 2806).

P. Oxy. VI, 863 = Eupolis fr. *101 K.-A. (= M.-P.3 1632; LDAB 892) and P. Oxy. XXXVII, 2806 (= M.-P.3 252.1; LDAB 5105) belong to the same hand. It may be safest to consider the papyrus an adespoton, perhaps the work of Cratinus.
